thread.title: A Flower Arrangement Inspired by Jasper Johns

author: Lindsey Taylor
title: A Flower Arrangement Inspired by Jasper Johns
text:
AMERICAN ARTIST Jasper Johns (b. 1930) lived in Tokyo when he painted 1964’s “Watchman,” my jumping-off point for this month’s arrangement. My goals: to reflect his palette, his exuberant brush strokes and the 3-D effects—and to nod to the Eastern provenance of the painting, on view until May 13 in the show “Something Resembling Truth,” at Los Angeles’s Broad museum. I chose two Japanese-inspired darkly glazed vessels and decided I would play with the ikebana style of arranging that’s rooted in Japan.
I wanted a tall arrangement...
